bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mona Rose, February 3, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks Rose for allowing him to visit with her and her grandmother.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mona Rose, February 3, 1942
div1.opener:
February 3, 1942
Miss Mona Rose
5450 West Walton Street
Chicago, Illinois
My dear Miss Rose:
div1.p:
I cannot tell you how greatly I appreciate
my visit with you and your grandmother the other morning.
It was a very hasty visit and I regretted the shortness
of it.

I had a very nice time with Mr. Lambert and
he was indeed interested to know of the address of your
grandmother and promised to call on you some time soon and
talk over points of mutual interest. He had a couple of
photographs of your uncle which he permitted me to bring
home to copy. I am taking good care of those you loaned
to me and will return them by registered insured post as
soon as our photographic department can get around to copy
them. We are all very busy at the moment.

By separate post I have sent to you and your
grandmother a little box of candy, a very simple expression
of my appreciation.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
